intro: Ilex mitis f. kilimandscharica, commonly known as the Kilimanjaro holly, is a variant of the evergreen holly native to the high-altitude regions of East Africa. It is characterized by its small, glossy, dark green leaves and produces red berries that are edible for birds. The plant thrives in cool, moist climates and is typically found in montane forests. It has a compact, shrub-like growth habit with dense foliage. Botanically, it is notable for its adaptability to high-altitude conditions and its role in local ecosystems.
